comments.body: This chainwork does not match the chainwork for the assumevalid block below.
Well the current testnet chainwork on my node is higher than that, so I guess it doesn't really matter.

It didn't before either. nMinimum is set at the the tip, but for testnet assume valid was set 20k blocks back due to reorgs. The reason for the difference is because even in a reorg the tip will be at or equal the minimum work, but it may not contain the old tip block.

Another possibility potentially less confusing for review it's also going back 20k blocks for the nMinimumChainWork to match the chain work of the chosen defaultAssumeValid.
As explained to me [last time](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9779#issuecomment-280536291) they don't need to match, but perhaps someone different will ask the same question on each major release and the gain of them not matching is dubious to me (it's also more work for the coder if they don't match).
